findings.title: Upgradability of Solana Program
findings.description: The program's upgrade authority can redeploy the program with malicious logic and gain unfair benefits from users, allowing them to transfer funds out from users' accounts.

findings.title: Account Collision
findings.description: The whitelisted users will be unable to register on the mintable launchpad due to an attacker using their address as a seed when claiming the NFT from a mintable launchpad.

findings.title: Improper Token Withdrawal from Launchpads
findings.description: The launchpad's owner can withdraw the NFT from the launchpad at any time, resulting in users not being able to claim the NFT from the launchpad.

findings.title: Improper Launchpad Setting
findings.description: The launchpad's owner can set the value of the launchpad during its duration, resulting in unreliability of the platform.

findings.title: Missing of Launchpad Register Validation
findings.description: The malicious users can bypass the whitelist checking and create many user_profile accounts in order to register the launchpad before the launchpad start time due to improper input validation.

findings.title: Insecure Source of Randomness
findings.description: A launchpad's owner can control the random result to select a specific NFT, giving an unfair advantage to the platform users.

findings.title: Improper Fee Enforcement
findings.description: The launchpad's owner will either lose all profits or have to pay an additional fee to the platform due to improper fee enforcement.

findings.title: Smart Contract with Unpublished Source Code
findings.description: The smart contract source code is not publicly published, which may cause users to misunderstand the functionalities and logic of the contract, leading to undesired actions.
